Nate_Laverdure:
Skyehawk:

I can understand why they are there for the audience

RSLs are safety equipment. They’re not there for the audience.

Skyehawk:

(Personally I find them annoying, although I can understand why they are there for the audience)

Ok, maybe not there for the audience, but they help the audience.

The “safety” argument is highly circumstantial - at least imo. They probably provide the most value at the practice field at competition, where the surroundings are not as known and there are people about that are not on your team.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-02-14T22:53:55.278Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":2,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":359,"readers_count":358,"score":156.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491747,"topic_slug":"rsl-stress-test","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/rsl-stress-test/491747/9","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":15},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5},{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":21,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3527525,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-14T22:56:13.848Z","cooked":"

They absolutely provide value to the field staff. They let field staff know the state of the robot. Its something that’s really nice to know when these are 150 lb machines that can cause real damage. Even in a controlled environment, you don’t lower safety requirements.

Skyehawk:

The “safety” argument is highly circumstantial - at least imo. They probably provide the most value at the practice field at competition, where the surroundings are not as known and there are people about that are not on your team.

The field staff would like a word.

He can’t hear you with his ear plugs in.

The RSL light has a purpose, but I am more tuned to looking at status lights of motor controllers to see if it is enabled or not. A RSL light with a light diffuser on it would be appreciated so it is not so bright when you are 2 feet from it in the pit.

FletcherS7:

Very useful for telling if the roboRIO just rebooted or if it’s off.

Or a very quick way to tell if your robot is disconnected from your driver station, or if there is a problem with your joysticks

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":22,"updated_at":"2025-02-15T03:35:36.451Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":17,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":58.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":491747,"topic_slug":"rsl-stress-test","display_username":"seg9585","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6078,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/rsl-stress-test/491747/19","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3527697,"name":"Steven Carmain","username":"Steven_Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-15T03:46:41.535Z","cooked":"

If the RSL is truly a safety device, there should be a rule for it being visible 25’ away and 270* around the robot.

The current definition of “visible 3’ from one side of the robot” does not meet that goal. (At least it changed from a couple years back from 3’ in front of robot; as an inspector, I had to hint this side is front). By that definition, you could bury the light so deep that you can’t see it unless your head is in the robot. The FTAs would have to run halfway around the field to get that update if it’s still flashing.
